sentence.Network_en: The news will come as a great relief to the French authorities.
sentence.Network_cn: 这个消息会让法国当局大大松一口气。

sentence.Network_en: The city authorities said the curfew had contained the violence.
sentence.Network_cn: 市政府称宵禁遏制住了暴力事件。

sentence.Network_en: Medical authorities were baffled, both as to its causes and its virulence.
sentence.Network_cn: 医疗当局对其病因及有多致命都还不甚了解。

那么授权（Authorization）又是什么呢？授权通常是用来回答以下问题：用户A是否被授权访问资源R 用户A是否被授权执行P操作

entry.def: The authorities are the people who have the power to make decisions and to make sure that laws are obeyed.

example.ex: This provided a pretext for the authorities to cancel the elections...
example.tran: 这给当局取消此次选举提供了借口。

example.ex: The prison authorities have been criticised for not moving more quickly to end the protest by inmates.
example.tran: 监狱当局因没有尽快采取行动制止犯人抗议而受到批评。

entry.def: An authority is an official organization or government department that has the power to make decisions.

example.ex: Any alterations had to meet the approval of the local planning authority.
example.tran: 任何改建都要取得当地规划机构的批准。

entry.def: Authority is the right to command and control other people.

example.ex: Local police chiefs should re-emerge as figures of authority and reassurance in their areas...
example.tran: 各地警察局局长应当重树其维护辖区安定的执法者形象。

example.ex: The judge had no authority to order a second trial.
example.tran: 法官无权进行二次审判。

entry.def: If someone has authority, they have a quality which makes other people take notice of what they say.

example.ex: He had no natural authority and no capacity for imposing his will on others.
example.tran: 他天生缺乏威信，根本没有能力把他的意志强加于人。

entry.def: Authority is official permission to do something.

example.ex: The prison governor has refused to let him go, saying he must first be given authority from his own superiors.
example.tran: 监狱长拒绝释放他，说他首先必须得到上级官员的许可。

entry.def: Someone who is an authority on a particular subject knows a lot about it.

example.ex: He's universally recognized as an authority on Russian affairs.
example.tran: 他是公认的俄罗斯事务专家。

entry.def: If you say you have it on good authority that something is true, you mean that you believe it is true because you trust the person who told you about it.

example.ex: I have it on good authority that there's no way this light can cause skin cancer.
example.tran: 我有来自权威人士的说法，这种光不可能引起皮肤癌。

means.word_mean: 1. the organization that is the governing authority of a political unit;

sentences.sentence: "the matter was referred to higher authorities"

Sentence.sentence: The German authorities are sending investigators to discover the cause of the plane crash late yesterday on the island of Tenerife.
